Incursion_details: Imported from Golden Acres, Harare to Ashburton Training Center, Pietermaritzburg
Incursion from nearby towns despite regular mass dog vaccination; caused rabies outbreak in wolves of Bale Mountains National Park
Study: Laurenson et al., 2005 (2); McQuiston, 2008 (3); Ehnert & Galland, 2009 (4)

Incursion_details: Suspected due to phylogenetic analysis catalysed by sharp increase in dog rabies cases in Limpopo province
Study: Zulu et al., 2008 (5);  Sabeta et al., 2011 (6); Townsend et al., 2013 (7)

Incursion_details: Suspected incursion from Nkomazi indicated by phylogenetic analysis; led to outbreak in other parts of Mpumalanga
Imported from KwaZulu-Natal; bit local pet dog in Witpoortjie, south Johannesberg where vaccination rate is low, resulting in outbreak in Gauteng Province
Study: Sabeta et al., 2013 (9); Weyer et al., 2020 (10); Ngoepe et al., 2022 (11)

Incursion_details: Suspected incursion from Lesotho into Sisonke district, KwaZulu-Natal indicated by phylogenetic analysis
Suspected incursion from North West Province indicated by phylogenetic analysis; led to jackal rabies outbreak in  uThukela, KwaZulu-Natal
Suspected incursion from Lesotho indicated by phylogenetic analysis; secondary transmission to 1 human (owner) in Underberg, Sisonke district, KwaZulu-Natal
Suspected human-mediated incursion into N’Djamena from surrounding areindicated by phylogenetic analysis
Suspected incursion from Zanzibar indicated by phylogenetic analysis; led to outbreak in Pemba during lapse in dog mass vaccination
Public_health_response: Mass dog vaccination, PEP (subsidized); outbreak ended in 2018

Incursion_details: Suspected incursion from North West Province indicated by phylogenetic analysis; led to outbreak in Gauteng Province
Imported from Nepal to Iran, where it was vaccinated against rabies
Adopted by owner during trip to Beer Sheva and brought back to residence
Public_health_response: Contact tracing, PEP, increased public awareness (tourists)
Study: David et al., 2004  (16);  David and Yakobson, 2011 (17)

Incursion_details: Imported from Sulawesi to Maluku islands for meat trade
Bit cow in Gongza village, Toetsho subdistrict, Trashiyangtse, resulting in outbreak that spread to other villages accessible to free-roaming dogs through road network
Public_health_response: Mass dog vaccination, PEP,  dog-catching,  vaccination of exposed animals,  increased public awareness
Study: Tenzin et al., 2011 (18); Townsend et al., 2013 (7); Rinchen et al., 2020 (19); Rinchen et al., 2020 (20)

Incursion_details: Suspected incursion from Hengshan city into Yongzhou city indicated by phylogenetic analysis; resulted in secondary transmission to local free-roaming owned dog, which visited neighbouring farm and attacked pigs, causing outbreak with 20 pig deaths out of >50 exposed as no control measures were initiated
Incursion into Dala subdistrict, Chhukha from India

Imported from Flores to Bukit Peninsula, Bali by fishermen with no border controls; bit owners and caused outbreak that spread to other regions with >200 human deaths including owner; delayed detection and response due to poor bite surveillance, non-existent PEP policies, insufficient vaccine stocks and prioritisation of culling
Study: Scott-Orr and Putra, 2009 (22); Clifton, 2010 (23); Batan et al., 2014 (24); Putra et al., 2013 (25); Mahardika et al., 2014 (26); Dibia et al., 2015 (27); Cliquet and Wasniewski, 2018 (28); De Jong et al., 2018 (29); Drake, 2020 (30); Rupprecht et al., 2020 (31); Ward and Brookes, 2021 (32)

Incursion_details: Incursion from south into southwest region of Bhutan
Study: Rinchen et al., 2020 (19); Rinchen et al., 2020 (20)

Incursion_details: Suspected incursion from Sichuan Province into Hanzhong District, Shaanxi Province indicated by phylogenetic analysis; transport of dogs for meat trade enabled outbreak that resulted in >7,000 biting incidents and 20 human deaths
Study: Zhao et al., 2011 (33); Zhang et al., 2014 (34);

Incursion_details: Incursion from Sumatra into Nias; caused 1 human rabies death after biting medical official
Study: Townsend et al., 2013 (7); Rupprecht et al., 2018 (35); Global Alliance for Rabies Control, 2024 (36)

Incursion_details: Suspected incursion from Baoding City, Hebei Province into Yangqu County, Shanxi Province indicated by phylogenetic analysis; resulted in secondary transmission to local owned dog which attacked neighbour’s sheep, causing outbreak; spread attributed to high numbers of unvaccinated free-roaming dogs
Public_health_response: Quarantine of exposed animals; sacrifice of associated animals (dog, sheep), mandatory vaccination of pets (owned dogs in the vicinity)

Incursion_details: Suspected incursion from Baoding, Hebei Province into Yangqu county, Shaanxi Province indicated by phylogenetic analysis; detected after secondary transmission to dog, which attacked neighbour's sheep and dog; spread due to unvaccinated free-roaming dogs in, lack of border control and meat trade facilitating movement of dogs
Public_health_response: Vaccination of exposed animals (dogs), sacrifice of associated animals (sheep)

Incursion_details: Suspected incursion from Mongolia into Republic of Buryatia through crossing of frozen river indicated by phylogenetic analysis; resulted in outbreak
Study: Adelshin et al., 2012 (38); Adelshin et al., 2015 (39)

Incursion_details: Brought by owners on camping trip to eastern coast of Sea of Galilee and Northern Israel and stayed outside, was bitten by local rabid stray dog and manifested symptoms after return to Israel; incomplete vaccination record (not rabies)
Suspected long-distance migration from Central Luzon region to Tablas Island, Romblon indicated by phylogenetic analysis
Suspected incursion from Mongolia into Republic of Buryatia through crossing of frozen river, indicated by phylogenetic analysis
Suspected incursion from Gangwon Province into Geyonggi Province indicated by phylogenetic analysis;

Suspected infection by by jackal that had been shot in the vicinity and tested positive for rabies; among group of >50 calves transported from dairy farm in Golan Heights, Kibbutz Ortal to Bet Zaid Village, Emek Izrael, Jezreel Valley

Suspected infection by jackal that had been shot in the vicinity and tested positive for rabies; among group of >50 calves transported from dairy farm in Golan Heights, Kibbutz Ortal to Bet Zaid Village, Emek Izrael, Jezreel Valley, and later transported to Kfar Yehoshua
Suspected incursion from Russia/Mongolia into  Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region (IMAR), China indicated by phylogenetic analysis; resulted in secondary transmission to cow
Suspected incursion from Russia/Mongolia into  Heilongjiang Province, China indicated by phylogenetic analysis; resulted in secondary transmission to goat
Suspected incursion from Thailand into Perlis, Malaysia indicated by phylogenetic analysis
Suspected incursion from Thailand into Kedah, Malaysia indicated by phylogenetic analysis

Incursion from Meral and Sakteng subdistricts into Rangjung town, Trashigang; bit 3 humans and caused secondary transmission to >20 animals (dogs, cattle, cat); spread facilitated by large stray dog population and lack of public health response, as cases were previously detected in neighboring villages 2-3 months prior

Incursion from West Bengal into Sikkim; bit 2 cows, causing secondary transmission; suspected infection by free-roaming dog while searching for food during winter, as dog vaccination coverage is low due to cultural beliefs that dogs should not be touched

Suspected incursion from West Kalimantan, Indonesia into Serian, Sarawak, Malaysia indicated by phylogenetic analysis; Attributed to workers bringing dogs during construction of Pan Borneo Highway; bit 2 children; spread facilitated by minimal rabies control at border and interaction of owned and stray dogs, resulting in outbreak
Study: Rupprecht et al., 2018 (35); Taib et al., 2019 (48); Leow et al., 2021 (45);  Ward and Brookes, 2021 (32); Global Alliance for Rabies Control, 2024 (36)

Incursion_details: Brought from Bali or Sulawesi to Sumbawa Island to guard corn crops from wild monkeys

Adopted by owners during camping trip in Morocco and imported to Langon, Gironde, France by driving through Spain; no border controls observed for rabies (FMD only); delayed reporting of contact with another dog by owners, resulting in fine for withholding information
Public_health_response: Contact tracing, PEP, quarantine, controlled movement of dogs, sacrifice of associated animals (dog)
Study: Bruyere-Masson et al., 2001 (49); Ribadeau-Dumas, 2016 (50); Alvarez et al., 2022 (51)

Incursion_details: Migrated to Morine, Kukesi Province and bit 3 humans; suspected infection by wild animal (wolf/fox) as no ORV along border
Study: WHO Collaborating Centre for Rabies Surveillance and Research, 2001 (52); Blanton et al., 2007 (53); Korro et al., 2009 (54); Lika, 2010 (55)

Incursion_details: Illegally imported from Belgrade, Serbia to Vienna, Austria and sold to new owners
Public_health_response: PEP, contact tracing, quarantine of exposed animals (dogs), sacrifice of associated animals (second dog of owners)
Study: Office International des Epizooties, 2001 (56); McElhinney et al., 2011 (57)

Animal_details: Owned (newly adopted),  recently vaccinated 1-month old puppy
Incursion_details: Adopted by worker in Azerbaijan, vaccinated and given health certificate without time for rabies antibodies to develop before importation to Bavaria, Germany
Study: WHO Collaborating Centre for Rabies Surveillance and Research, 2001 (58); Johnson et al., 2011(15);  Ribadeau-Dumas, 2016 (50); Alvarez et al., 2022 (51)

Incursion_details: Imported from Nepal to Germany
Incursion from Slovenia to Carinthia, Austria; caused outbreak resulting in >20 rabid animals
Illegally imported from Morocco to Seine Saint Denis, France without vaccination certificate
Study: WHO Collaborating Centre for Rabies Surveillance and Research, 2001 (58); Lardon, 2010 (61); Johnson et al., 2011 (15); Mailles et al., 2011 (62);  Ribadeau-Dumas, 2016 (50); Alvarez et al., 2022 (51)

Incursion_details: Suspected to have been illegally imported from North Africa and abandoned in Nyon, Geneva, Switzerland; found and brought to animal shelter, later adopted
Study: Zanoni and  Breitenmoser, 2003 (63); Johnson et al., 2011 (15);  Ribadeau-Dumas, 2016 (50);

Incursion_details: Imported from Estonia to Finland without vaccination, in accordance with local guidelines (rabies vaccination recommended but not required, contrary to OIE standards); was released to pasture with other horses; bit veterinarian during examination
Public_health_response: PEP (veterinarian), vaccination of exposed animals (horses), quarantine of exposed animals (horses)
Study: Englund and Pringle, 2003 (64);  Rimhanen-Finne et al., 2009 (65); Metlin et al., 2016 (66); Zoonoosikeskus (Zoonoses Centre), 2012 (67); Dominguez et al., 2016 (68)

Incursion_details: Illegally imported from Morocco via Melilla, Spain to Lorient, France
Illegally imported from Morocco via Spain to St. Gery, France
Illegally imported from Morocco, brought by owner through Ceuta, Spain, to Gironde, Aquitaine, Bordeaux France in car but allowed to roam unleashed at 3 summer music festivals, exposing >150 humans
Public_health_response: Culling (free-roaming dogs only) Contact tracing (hotline established), PEP, monitoring of animals
Study: Health Protection Agency, 2005 (70); Servas et al., 2005 (69); Lardon, 2010 (61); Ribadeau-Dumas, 2016 (50); Alvarez et al., 2022 (51)

Incursion_details: Illegally imported from Morocco to Gironde, France
Study: Johnson et al., 2011 (15); Alvarez et al., 2022 (51)

Incursion_details: Illegally imported from Morocco to Finistère, France despite lacking pet passport
Study: Johnson et al., 2011 (15); Mailles et al., 2011 (62);  Alvarez et al., 2022 (51)

Incursion_details: Imported from Morocco without complete travel requirements (no vaccination, pet passport or health certificate), but import permission was requested and granted under condition of vaccination and quarantine at owner's house in Germany; dog died in quarantine in Hannover
Public_health_response: PEP, contact tracing, sacrifice of associated animals with confirmed direct exposure (cat), vaccination of  associated animals (dogs)
Study: Johnson et al., 2011 (15); Ribadeau-Dumas, 2016 (50); Alvarez et al., 2022 (51)

Incursion_details: Incursion from Hesse to Rhineland-Palatinate after ORV preventive vaccination cordon
Public_health_response: ORV (changed from baits to aerial, at 6-week intervals instead of every autumn)
Study: Selhorst et al., 2012 (71); Cliquet and Wasniewski, 2018 (28)

Incursion_details: Imported from Morocco to Melilla, Spain

Imported from Morocco despite visible injuries and short duration between rabies vaccination and travel; brought by owner to beach in Portugal, then passed Spain on the way to Grandpuits, Seine-et-Marne, Hautes-Pyrénées, Ger, France; In direct contact with 1 dog, which later associated with 1 other dog; resulted in secondary transmission to 1 dog, with France losing rabies-free status for 2 years
Study: Eurosurveillance, 2008 (73); Gautret et al., 2011 (74); Johnson et al., 2011 (15); Ribadeau-Dumas, 2016 (50); Yamada et al., 2019 (75); Alvarez et al., 2022 (51)

Incursion_details: Adopted by owner while on vacation in Morocco and imported to Beersel, Brussels, Belgium; checked by Morocco veterinarian and cleared for importation despite not fulfilling rabies vaccination and serology requirements; owners not informed of pet passport, resulting in smuggling of dog on plane in handbag; no border control measures observed; checked by 2nd veterinarian in Belgium but not vaccinated for rabies; brought to dog park; resulted in Belgium losing rabies-free status for 6 months
Public_health_response: Contact tracing, PEP, 6-month quarantine (visitor dogs at dog park), sacrifice of associated pets, recommended pet vaccination, enhanced surveillance, restrictions, active fox surveillance, mandatory dog leashing
Study: European Food Safety Authority, 2007 (72); Van Gucht and Le Roux , 2008 (76); Ehnert & Galland, 2009 (4); Johnson et al., 2011 (15); Ribadeau-Dumas, 2016 (50); Alvarez et al., 2022 (51)

Incursion_details: Incursion from Republic of North Macedonia into Štrpca, Kosovo; 1 fox found near police station, 1 fox found near holding
Illegally imported from Morocco to Germany

Animal_details: Owned, formerly free-roaming, recently vaccinated puppy born to stray dog
Incursion_details: Rescued from streets in India while attacked by stray dog; vaccinated <30 days before importation to Finland
Study: European Food Safety Authority, 2009; Johnson et al., 2011 (15);  Zoonoosikeskus (Zoonoses Centre), 2012 (67); Väyrynen, 2020 (78)

Incursion_details: Adopted in Gambia; fulfilled all travel requirements for except serology; wounded but given health certificate; imported to Uccle, Belgium, brought into passenger cabin of plane; driven to France
Public_health_response: Contact tracing, PEP, 6-month quarantine of exposed animals (cats)
Study: Eurosurveillance, 2008 (79); Roux and Gucht, 2008 (80); European Food Safety Authority, 2010 (81);  Ribadeau-Dumas, 2016 (50); Cliquet and Wasniewski, 2018 (28); Alvarez et al., 2022 (51)

Incursion_details: Imported from Sri Lanka by rescue group along with >10 animals despite not meeting minimum age requirement for travel; quarantined in Chingford Kennels, Heathrow, London where symptoms manifested
Public_health_response: Contact tracing, PEP, sacrifice of associated animals (nearby dogs at quarantine center)
Study: Catchpole et al., 2008 (82); Fooks et al., 2008 (83); Goddard et al., 2008 (84); Health Protection Agency, 2008 (85); WHO Collaborating Centre for Rabies Surveillance & Research, 2009 (86);  European Food Safety Authority, 2010 (81); Johnson et al., 2011 (15); Johnson et al., 2011 (87); Fooks and Johnson, 2015 (88); Ribadeau-Dumas, 2016 (50); Alvarez et al., 2022 (51)

Incursion_details: Illegally imported from Croatia to animal shelter in Lörrach, Baden-Württemberg, Germany without vaccination certificate; no border control measures reported at EU border
Public_health_response: Contact tracing, PEP, quarantine of exposed animals
Study: Johnson et al., 2011 (15); Weiss et al., 2009 (89);  European Food Safety Authority, 2010 (81);  Ribadeau-Dumas, 2016 (50); Alvarez et al., 2022 (51)

Incursion_details: Found in car park in Malaga, Spain; transported by owner to Saint André-le-Gaz, France by car
Incursion from Slovenia into Venzone, Udine; 1 fox bit 1 human, and caused rabies spread to other regions; ORV not maintained during that period
Study: De Benedictis et al., 2008 (90); Fusaro et al., 2013 (91); Berg et al, 2015 (92); Rupprecht et al., 2020 (31); Kumar et al., 2021 (93); Lojkić et al., 2021 (94)

Incursion_details: Continued incursion from Italy into Belluno, Venzone Province following Udine incursion from Slovenia; caused rabies spread to other regions
Study: Fusaro et al., 2013 (91); Berg et al, 2015 (92); Rupprecht et al., 2020 (31); Kumar et al., 2021 (93); Lojkić et al., 2021 (94)

Incursion_details: Found on highway in Spain and illegally imported to Isère, France; suspected incursion from Morocco indicated by phylogenetic analysis
Study: Mailles et al., 2011 (62); Alvarez et al., 2022 (51)

Incursion_details: Imported from Croatia to Germany; no border control measures reported
Imported from Afghanistan to France
Study: WHO Collaborating Centre for Rabies Surveillance & Research, 2009 (96); Johnson et al., 2011 (15)

Incursion_details: Imported from Bosnia and Herzegovina to Neustadt an der Aisch, Bavaria, Germany; incomplete travel documents (no record of rabies vaccination) but allowed through border control; history of biting by aggressive dog
Public_health_response: Contact tracing, PEP, destroyed associated animals (unvaccinated cats)
Study: Eismann et al., 2011 (97); Johnson et al., 2011 (15);  European Food Safety Authority and European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control, 2012 (98); Ribadeau-Dumas, 2016 (50); Alvarez et al., 2022 (51)

Incursion_details: Incursion into Rzeszow, Poland
Incursion into Lublin, Poland
Incursion into Malopolskie region, Poland; caused outbreak, resulting from weak surveillance (minimal sample collection)
Study: Berg et al, 2015 (92); Ortiz et al., 2018 (100)

Incursion_details: Illegally imported from Morocco to Vendée, France; did not fulfil all travel requirements (underage, unvaccinated, not microchipped, no travel certificate)
Public_health_response: Contact tracing, PEP, (booster) vaccination of exposed animals (dogs), sacrifice of associated animals (cats)
Study: Mailles et al., 2011 (62); Roberts and Lopez, 2011 (101);  European Food Safety Authority and European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control, 2013 (102); Alvarez et al., 2022 (51)

Incursion_details: Incursion from Svalbard mainland into Hopen Island by crossing frozen sea ice during winter; attacked 4 dogs at Hopen Metereological Station, killed by dog
One of 1,000 cows imported from Brasov, Romania to Osje ko-Baranjska county, Croatia with valid documents (health certificates) but no rabies vaccination required; 6 bulls exhibited symptoms
Public_health_response: Sacrifice of associated animals (bulls in same box)

Incursion_details: Incursion from Russia into Svalbard, Norway by crossing frozen sea ice
Incursion from Kaliningrad Oblast, Russia into Warminsko-Mazurskie, Poland

Purchased in parking lot and illegally imported from Morocco to Amsterdam, Netherlands via Spain; examined at customs but pet passport and vaccination status not checked; stayed in passenger cabin of plane
Public_health_response: Contact tracing, PEP, (booster) vaccination of exposed animals (dogs), sacrifice of associated animals (cats) due to lack of available venue for quarantine
Study: Roberts and Lopez, 2012 (107); Van Rijckevorse et al., 2012 (108);  Ribadeau-Dumas, 2016 (50); Veda et al., 2021 (109); Alvarez et al., 2022 (51)

Incursion_details: Incursion from Republic of North Macedonia into West Macedonia Region (Kozani Regional Unit), Greece; observed with symptoms by villagers; led to secondary transmission to 6 foxes and 2 dogs; spread attributed to neglect of ORV and lack of mountains
Public_health_response: ORV, improved passive surveillance,  mandatory pet vaccination, increased public awareness
Study: Tsiodras et al., 2013 (110); Tsiodras et al., 2014 (111);  Giannakopoulos et al., 2016 (112); Rupprecht et al., 2020 (31);  Lojkić et al., 2021 (94)

Incursion_details: Attempted importation to Morocco 4 months prior but denied due to lack of serology test; transported from Spain to Morocco by owner immediately after vaccination; illegally imported (suspected entry point through Ceuta) back to Argés, Toledo, Castilla-La; owners did not have permanent home and were living in van; escaped, attacked 5 humans and died, resulting in loss of rabies-free status in Spain for 6 months; owners fined for not disclosing all information
Public_health_response: Contact tracing, PEP, mandatory pet vaccination (animals in Castilla-La Mancha restriction area), serology of all exposed dogs,  sacrifice of associated animals (dog with insufficient antibodies according to serology), restricted animal movement
Study: Suarez-Rodriguez at al., 2013 (113); Pérez de Diego et al., 2015 (114);  Ribadeau-Dumas, 2016 (50); Veda et al., 2021 (109); Alvarez et al., 2022 (51)

Incursion_details: Imported from Morocco  to Val d'Oise, France with certificate of good health despite not meeting qualifications for importation; escaped home and was adopted twice by different owners
Public_health_response: Contact tracing, PEP, monitoring of vaccinated animals, sacrifice of associated animals (non-vaccinated), restricted movement of pets, increased surveillance

Incursion_details: Incursion from Poland into Slovakia despite ORV

Illegally imported from Hungary to Loire, Rhone-Alpes region, France as a puppy without fulfilling travel requirements (vaccination, identification, underage); brought to Algeria 4 months later by owners despite surveillance orders, escaped for a period; manifested symptoms after return to France and had direct contact with 9 humans and 1 dog
Public_health_response: Contact tracing, PEP, sacrifice of associated animals (unvaccinated),  monitoring of vaccinated animals (dogs) for 6 months, catching of stray animals, restricted movement of pets,  increased surveillance
Study: European Food Safety Authority and European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control, 2015 (117); Veterinary Record, (2015) (118); Veda et al., 2021 (109); Alvarez et al., 2022 (51)

Incursion_details: Imported from Russia to Riverstick, Ireland
Study: European Food Safety Authority and European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control, 2021 (119)

Incursion_details: Illegal importation from Morocco to France
Study: Bacigalupo et al., 2022 (120); European Food Safety Authority and European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control, 2021 (119); Veda et al., 2021 (109); Alvarez et al., 2022 (51)

Incursion_details: Incursion from Belarus into farmyard in Izabela, Otwock, Mazowieckie voivoideship; observed to be ‘sick’, killed by dog; spread facilitated by limitation of ORV to borders only
Public_health_response: Increased public awareness, increased rabies surveillance, hunting ban, cancellation of pet-centric events, mandatory leashing of dogs, emergency ORV

Incursion_details: Illegally imported from Turkey to Lower Saxony, Germany
Study: Alvarez et al., 2022 (51); European Food Safety Authority and European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control, 2022 (122)

Incursion_details: Suspected illegal importation from Morocco to shelter in Évry-Courcouronnes, Essonne, Île-de France region, France; bit several humans
Public_health_response: Contact tracing, PEP, monitoring of shelter

Incursion_details: Incursion from Pennsylvania into Ohio, USA despite immune corridor from ORV; attributed to weakened surveillance
Incursion from Greenland into Newfoundland, Canada by crossing through packed ice during winter, indicated by phylogenetic analysis
Incursion from mainland Labrador to Cartwright, Labrador by crossing through packed ice; overlap with red fox populations facilitated spread in arctic foxes
Imported from Puerto Rico into Massachusetts, USA
Incursion from Mexico into Webb County, Texas, USA
Imported from Thailand to Los Angeles, California, USA; given health certificate despite history of respiratory illness; stayed in passenger cabin
Study: Castrodale et al., 2008 (126);  McQuiston, 2008 (3); Ehnert & Galland, 2009 (4);  Lankau et al., 2014 (125)

Incursion_details: Suspected incursion from mid-Atlantic state to Ohio, USA (although phylogenetic analysis indicates earlier occurrence); detected despite weakened surveillance, limited testing
Study: Russell et al., 2005 (127); Henderson et al., 2008 (128);  Slate et al., 2008 (129)

Incursion_details: Incursion into Barnstable, Cape Cod from nearby areas in Massachusetts; crossed vaccine barrier, resulting in epizootic

Incursion from mid-Atlantic state to Tennessee; found during enhanced surveillance in non-ORV area; suspected infection by raccoon, indicated by phylogenetic analysis; ORV not recommended, considered ‘waste of resources’
Incursion from Vermont to Monteregie region, Dunham, Brome-Missisquoi, Quebec, Canada
Study: Shwiff et al., 2013 (131); Stevenson et al., 2016 (132); Trewby et al., 2017 (133);  Nadin-Davis, 2018 (134); Nadin-Davis et al., 2020 (135)

Incursion_details: Imported from New Delhi, India to Seattle, Washington by volunteer veterinarian; given to 2nd veterinarian; despite symptoms and biting history (veterinarian owner, dog), health certificate obtained from 3rd veterinarian for travel to Juneau, Alaska
Public_health_response: PEP, contact tracing, sacrifice of associated pets (dog)
Study: Blanton et al., 2008 (136); Castrodale et al., 2008 (126); Ehnert & Galland, 2009 (4); Lankau et al., 2014 (125)

Incursion_details: Adopted by soldier and kept on military base for 7 months before vaccination and importation; transported with >20 dogs with no vaccination certificates;   to New Jersey, USA, leading to 30-day quarantine for all animals; diagnosed in quarantine centre
Public_health_response: Contact tracing, PEP, vaccination of associated animals (dogs, cat); 6-month quarantine of exposed animals (dogs, cat)
Study: Mangieri et al., 2008 (137); Lankau et al., 2014 (125); Hercules et al., 2018 (138)

Incursion_details: Imported from Mexico to Texas, USA without documentation; suspected infection by vampire bat, indicated by phylogenetic analysis
Study: Blanton et al., 2011 (139); Pieracci et al., 2020 (140)

Incursion_details: Incursion from mainland Georgia to Jekyll Island by crossing bridge;  associated with 2013 - 2017 epizootic

Found in area with ongoing outbreak, scavenging for food with   other dogs (mother and newborn litter); imported from Nunavut, Quebec to Calgary, Alberta with layover in Edmonton; no vaccination requirement for in-country travel; suspected infection by arctic fox, indicated by phylogenetic analysis
Public_health_response: PEP, quarantine of exposed animals (mother and litter dogs), sacrifice of associated animals (dog negative for rabies but euthanized at request of owner)

Incursion_details: Found in construction work camp in Nunavut, Quebec and imported to Edmonton with layover in Yellowknife, Northwest Territories; further travel by car to Saskatoon Health Region, Saskatchewan; no vaccination requirement for in-country travel; manifested symptoms during travel and bit owner; suspected infection by arctic fox, indicated by phylogenetic analysis
Public_health_response: PEP, vaccination of exposed animal (dog), 45-day quarantine of exposed animal (dog)

Animal_details: Owned (newly adopted), presumed vaccinated adult female with 1 puppy
Incursion_details: Found on street in Cairo, Egypt and imported to Virginia, USA by animal rescue organization along with >30 pets (dogs, cats) despite fracture injury; transported in same crate with own puppy; falsified vaccination certificate
Public_health_response: Contact tracing, PEP, vaccination of exposed animals (puppy, booster for vaccinated dogs), quarantine of exposed dogs (puppy)
Study: Sinclair et al., 2015 (142); Pieracci et al., 2020 (140); Latzer et al., 2022 (143)

Incursion_details: Suspected long-distance incursion from New York, USA into Hamilton, Ontario, Canada by stowing away on truck or ship; picked up by animal control along with 2 dogs; escaped cage and fought with dog; resulted in outbreak (>400 animals)
Public_health_response: PEP, mass vaccination, ORV, enhanced surveillance (increased testing of sick animals), increased public awareness
Study: Stevenson et al., 2016 (132); Trewby et al., 2017 (133);  Lobo et al., 2018 (144);  Gilbert & Chipman, 2020 (145); Nadin-Davis et al., 2020 (135)

Incursion_details: Suspected incursion from New York, USA into Mohawk Nation, Akwesasne, Quebec, Canada indicated by phylogenetic analysis
Study: Birhane et al., 2017 (146); Trewby et al., 2017 (133); Nadin-Davis et al., 2020 (135)

Incursion_details: Suspected incursion from Maine, USA into New Brunswick, Canada (although phylogenetic analysis indicates earlier occurrence)
Suspected human-mediated incursion from Connecticut into Hicksville, Nassau County, Long Island, New York indicated by phylogenetic analysis
Imported from Ames, Iowa to Johnsonville, New York for vacation; attacked 1 dog, 3 humans; suspected infection by skunk indicated by phylogenetic analysis
Suspected incursion from Connecticut into Sound Beach, Suffolk County, New York indicated by phylogenetic analysis

Animal_details: Owned (newly-adopted), unvaccinated (for rabies), adult female with 3 kittens
Incursion_details: Imported from North Carolina to Arkansas along with >10 other pets (cats, dogs) then travelled to Summit County, Ohio and gave birth; surrendered to Humane Society of Summit County;  vaccinated but not for rabies (according to facility guidelines, rabies vaccination only administered at time of spay/neuter); suspected infection by raccoon in North Carolina indicated by phylogenetic analysis
Public_health_response: PEP, vaccination of exposed animals (recommended), 6-month quarantine of exposed animals (cats)

Incursion_details: Imported from Westchester County to Long Island, New York;  bit veterinary staff; suspected infection by raccoon indicated by phylogenetic analysis

Imported from Egypt with 3 other dogs by animal rescue organization to JFK airport, New York then Connecticut despite injuries; suspected falsified rabies vaccination document;  bit 1 human (flight parent) before boarding plane
Public_health_response: Contact tracing, PEP, booster vaccination of exposed animals (dogs), quarantine of exposed animals (dogs), monitoring
Study: Blanton et al., 2009 (149); Hercules et al., 2018 (138); Chevalier & Havas, 2019 (150); Latzer et al., 2022 (143)

Incursion_details: Imported from Egypt to Port Huron to Toronto, Canada with >20 other dogs; brought by car through Port Hurton, Michigan to Kansas City; fostered with >10 animals (dogs, cats); bit 1 human (veterinary technician) during examination; had rabies vaccination certificate but serologic testing showed lack of vaccination in some dogs, indicating vaccination failure or falsification of vaccination certificate
Public_health_response: PEP, suspension of dogs entering USA from Egypt, vaccination of exposed animals (booster) and 45-day monitoring, 6-month quarantine of exposed animals (unvaccinated dogs), quarantine of imported animals (dogs) and serologic monitoring
Study: Raybern et al, 2019 (151); Latzer et al., 2022 (143)

Incursion_details: Imported from Virginia zoo to Tennessee Zoo, Washington County; suspected infection by raccoon indicated by phylogenetic analysis
Public_health_response: Contact tracing, PEP, vaccination of exposed animal (tamandua) that was presumed unvaccinated due to missing vaccination records), quarantine of exposed animal (tamandua)

Incursion_details: Imported with >30 other animals (dogs, cat) by animal rescue organization from Baku, Azerbaijan to Chicago O’Hare airport, Illinois, USA; relocated to Pennsylvania; serologic testing showed insufficient levels despite confirmed vaccination in Egypt, indicating vaccination failure due to underdosing
Public_health_response: Contact tracing, PEP, (booster) vaccination of exposed animals (dogs, cat), serologic monitoring and 45-day quarantine of imported animals (dogs), suspension of dog importations from DMRVV high-risk countries

Animal_details: Owned (newly adopted),  presumed vaccinated three-month-old puppy
Incursion_details: Imported from Tehran, Iran by animal rescue organization to Ontario, Canada through Frankfurt, Germany; was not revaccinated upon arrival despite vaccination policy for young dogs
Public_health_response: Contact tracing, PEP, (booster) vaccination of exposed animals (dog), 3-month quarantine of exposed animal (dog) due to delayed identification

Incursion_details: Incursion from Germán Busch Province into Corumbá, Mato Grosso do Sul, Brazil; attributed to high numbers of free-roaming dogs

Incursion from Puno into Arequipa; attributed to low vaccination rate among free-roaming dogs, commonly found foraging in water channels throughout city that collect garbage for foraging during dry season; resulted in outbreak
Study: Castillo-Neyra et al., 2017 (157); Castillo-Neyra et al., 2017 (158); Raynor et al., 2020 (159)

Incursion_details: Incursion from Bolivia into Maranhão; further spread led to outbreak in Mato Grosso do Sul
